inclusion.criterion: Disease status: chronic hepatitis C infection
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Treatment: direct acting antiviral drugs (Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir ± ribavirin) for 12 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Negative hepatitis B virus surface Ag and HIV antibodies
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No history of hepatocellular carcinoma or development of hepatocellular carcinoma during the treatment period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No other causes of chronic liver disease (alcohol consumption more than 80 g/day, hepatotoxic drugs, autoimmune hepatitis, primary biliary cholangitis, hemochromatosis and Wilson's disease)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: HCV co-infection with hepatitis B virus(HBV) or human immunodeficiency virus(HIV)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Presence of other causes of chronic liver disease (alcohol consumption more than 80 g/day, hepatotoxic drugs, autoimmune hepatitis, primary biliary cholangitis, hemochromatosis and Wilson's disease).
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has a history of HCV co-infection with HBV, which may trigger exclusion. However, the overall assessment is likely eligible due to other inclusion criteria being met.
